Review Title: I’m definitely not coming back to this one

- Very old building and place
- Corridor smells like mold
- Water pressure is minimal, so if you have long hair and planning to wash it, prepare yourself.
- No hair dryer and no shampoo either
- Main door only open if there’s someone, not well prepared for customers to be able to walk in.
- Kitchen is…let’s say I wouldn’t use it, very old and the adjacent “dining room” has like a smaller area packed with towels/bedsheets etc
- The second day, one of our towels was changed (yes, only one, not both?) and I found a very nice long black hair…taking into account I saw the kitchen area and what was in front of the washing machine I just used my old one.

The bedsheets and the room/bathroom are clean but because the place is so old, it doesn’t seem clean, especially the furniture (nightstands and desk that seemed from 20years ago, not that I used them but the vibe they were giving was not nice).
The corridor smells like mold/humidity, luckily the room we stayed in didn’t.
The first night after walking all day long in London and being freaking exhausted, we came to see a note on the door that said “Sorry reception will be open again in 3 mins”. The poor guy had to go to another hotel to turn the heating on (double job single pay apparently). We didn’t have a key for the front door so we had no choice but to wait, luckily I was with my boyfriend and it isn’t a dodgy area, don’t even wanna think if I was alone and  someone was behind or something like that…
Overall, if you just need a bed and some water to shower (our shower was in the room), should do it. If you’re a bit picky you will not enjoy this. I’m more on the picky side, tried not to touch anything than I didn’t have to really touch, but that’s me.
